definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Zhang Shizhao was a famous statesman and political critic in modern Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 章士釗是我國近現代史上著名的政治活動家和政論家。

sentences.english: Liang Qichao was a famous activist and statesman in mod ern China.
sentences.chinese: 梁啓超近代中國著名的報刊活動家和政論家。

sentences.english: The Chinese Progress is one of the most famous political comment newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 《時務報》是近代著名的政論報刊之一。

sentences.english: That's the political treatise written in 1642.
sentences.chinese: 這是1642年寫成的一篇政論。

sentences.english: Political writings play an increasingly important role in the political life of people.
sentences.chinese: 政論文在人們的政治生活中發揮着舉足輕重的作用。

sentences.english: He did not receive them. A technocrat met them instead.
sentences.chinese: 他沒接見他們，而去見了政論家。

definition: forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books

pinyin: li4 shi3 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4

definition: variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]
